greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Total number of colors in all colored compositions of n using all colors of an initial interval of the color palette such that all parts have different color patterns and the patterns for parts i have i colors in (weakly) increasing order.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..200
maple: b:= proc(n, i, k, p) option remember; `if`(n=0, p!, `if`(i<1, 0, add(
b(n-i*j, min(n-i*j, i-1), k, p+j)*C(C(k+i-1, i), j), j=0..n/i)))
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Sep 17 2019
